page.title: 16Beetham W.I.
page.content: Founded in 1918, Beetham is the second oldest W.I. in Westmorland, and still has one of the original members. They have always had a reputation for a very high standard of craft work. Several members excel in the rural crafts of basketry, spinning, knitting and woodwork. They meet monthly in the village school, and a wide variety of subjects is included in the yearly syllabus, ranging from talks on antiques, old silver, and interesting travel programmes, to old and modern cookery techniques and the use of micro-wave ovens. Musical evenings are particularly popular, and they still sing "Jerusalem" with real fervour. They support the Westmorland Show, take care of the War Memorial, and assist in the preservation of the church.
